section.name: Demultiplexing step
section.p:
This step allow to launch demultiplexing using CASAVA or bcl2fastq. Aozan can use samplesheet in XLS format or generated by an external tool in addition of samplesheet in CSV format. Using sample sheet in XLS format allow to use alias for adapters sequences indexes.
See an example of casava design file.

Alongside Aozan, we provide a standalone CASAVA samplesheet validator available on our website that allows you to check your run design and generate a valid CSV design file. The tool is available here.
The next table contains the main parameters of this step.

tr.td: Factor to use to get the estimation of space needed in fastq directory for the run from the space used in bcl directory by the run
If it is true and no synchronization step, use direct Hiseq output for demultiplexage step
Path to a file that contains alias for adapters sequences indexes. See an example.
Adapter sequence file to use when launch CASAVA/bcl2fastq
CASAVA samplesheet format ("csv", "xls" or "command"). (before Aozan-1.1, name casava.design.format)
Command to execute to generate the CASAVA samplesheet in CSV format when casava.samplesheet.format parameter is set to "command"
Path to CSV/XLS samplesheet files. (before Aozan-1.1, name casava.designs.path)
Number of mismatches allowed in adapters indexes
Path to CASAVA or Bcl2fastq basedir
Add reads that not pass Illumina filter in fastq files
Number of threads to use for demultiplexing

section.p: The next table contains the parameters required for bcl2fastq 1.8.4 but not bcl2fastq 2.

tr.td: Compression to use (.bz2, .gz, none, bzip2, gz, gzip). To use format bzip2, read "how installing bcl2fastq".
Cluster number by fastq file. When set to 0 no limit will be set

section.p: Nota Bene: with bcl2fastq2, it is no more possible to change default compression format "gz" in "bzip2". In the near future, Aozan will include a new functionality to convert the compressed FASTQ files.
section.h4: Configuration to run bcl2fastq with Docker images.
section.p: This Aozan version can run Docker image for demultiplexing step. On our platform, we build a new image for each bcl2fastq version. We can downloaded from the repository genomic paris center

tr.td: Enable to use Docker container to run bcl2fastq for demultiplexing.

Full name on Docker image container to use. Example RTA version1 (software Illumina Real Time Analysis 1, it used with HiSeq sequencer). To use previous version on blc2fastq, we should call 1.8.4 Docker image name.
Full name on Docker image container to use.

section.p: Nota Bene: actually, Aozan check syntax on samplesheet for version 1 and 2 on bcl2fastq software. For bcl2fastq version 2, in session Data, the header column Sample_Name is forbidden.
